3 Cal. 2d 584 (1935)
In the Matter of the Estate of HENRY C. FINKLER, Deceased. CHRISTINA A. FINKLER, Appellant,
v.
M. J. PURCELL et al., Respondents.
S. F. No. 14681. 
Supreme Court of California. In Bank.  
May 3, 1935.
 Henry Eickhoff, Henry Eickhoff, Jr., George W. Wilson, J. E. McCurdy, F. J. Kilmartin and Knight, Boland & Riordan for Appellants.
 Ross & Ross for Respondents.
 PRESTON, J.
 This record presents two main questions for consideration: First, that of the validity of the testamentary attempt of Henry C. Finkler, deceased, involving a claim of insanity and undue influence, and, second, that of proper construction of the instrument in case its probate is declared valid.
 The decedent was for some fifty-two years a loyal attache of this court, serving it in various capacities and particularly as its senior secretary. This latter work was performed until the day next prior to his tragic death.
